page.title: 06KIRKBY FLEETHAM C.E.SCHOOL
page.content: {KIRKBY FLEETHAM C.E.SCHOOL}WAS BUILT BY THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE MID 1800'S THE LAND BEING GIVEN BY A LOCAL LANDOWNER.IT REPLACED A FORMER DAME SCHOOL ON THE SITE OF WHAT IS NOW THE CLOSE.EARLIER THIS CENTURY THERE WERE UP TO 100 PUPILS AND, DURING THE 2ND WORLD WAR,EVACUEES FROM SUNDERLAND. NOW THERE ARE ON AVERAGE 40 PUPILS DISTRIBUTED AMONGST TWO FULL TIME TEACHERS.THERE IS A STAFF OF 7 - HEADTEACHER,ASSISTANT TEACHER,PART- TIME TEACHER,CLERICAL ASSISTANT, NON-TEACHING ASSISTANT,CARETAKER AND DINING ROOM ASSISTANT.LUNCHES ARE SERVED DAILY BUT ARE COOKED AT ROMANBY SCHOOL IN NORTHALLERTON AND DELIVERED BY TAXI.MANY CHILDREN BRING THEIR OWN PACKED LUNCHES.SEVERAL PEOPLE COME TO SCHOOL BY TAXI -PROVIDED BY NORTH YORKSHIRE COUNTY C.
